description: There is a row of m houses in a small city, each house must be painted with one of the n colors (labeled from 1 to n), some houses that have been painted last summer should not be painted again. A neighborhood is a maximal group of continuous houses that are painted with the same color. Given an array houses, an m x n matrix cost and an integer target where: Return the minimum cost of painting all the remaining houses in such a way that there are exactly target neighborhoods. If it is not possible, return -1.
